city.cs.engine

Class SoundClip

  • java.lang.Object
    • city.cs.engine.SoundClip

  • public class SoundClip
extends Object
    Sound clips loaded from audio files. If exceptions are thrown when loading mp3 or other compressed audio file formats, check that you have appropriate support libraries on your classpath. Libraries can be obtained from http://www.javazoom.net/mp3spi/sources.html. 
     Contributors:
  seb  (soi.city.ac.uk) - initial API and implementation
  Matthias Pfisterer - code for converting compressed formats, adapted from
  AudioPlayer (http://jsresources.org/); code adapted from AudioPlayer is
  covered by the following notices:

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SoundClip(String fileName)
      Initialise a new sound clip from the named audio file.

      Initialise a new sound clip from the audio file located at the given url.

      Permanently close the clip.

      Close the clip if still open when garbage collected.

      Pause the playing of the clip.

      Resume playing a paused clip.

        UnsupportedAudioFileException
        IOException
        LineUnavailableException

    • Method Detail

      • setVolume

        public void setVolume(double volume)
        Adjust the volume of the sound. A value of 1.0 (the default) means the sound will play at its normal level, 0.5 at half normal level, 2.0 at twice normal level, and so on.
        Parameters:
        volume - The multiplier to apply to the clip's default volume level.

      • play

        public void play()
        Play the clip from the start.

      • loop

        public void loop()
        Start playing the clip in a continuous loop.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop playing the clip. Does nothing if the clip is not playing.

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Resume playing a paused clip.

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Pause the playing of the clip.

      • close

        public void close()
        Permanently close the clip. The clip will no longer play.

      • finalize

        protected void finalize()
                 throws Throwable
        Close the clip if still open when garbage collected.
        Overrides:
        finalize in class Object
        Throws:
        Throwable
